meanings.definition: Having more humps than something else.
meanings.sent1: The camel with two humps is humpier than the one with just one.
meanings.sent2: The hill looked humpier than the smooth road beside it.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy mattress felt even humpier after the cat decided to nap on it.
meanings.sent4: The landscape became humpier as we ventured further into the desert.
meanings.sent5: The bumpy ride on the old wagon made the road feel even humpier than before.

meanings.sent1: He tried to humpier the sandcastle by adding more mounds to it.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor decided to humpier the clay figure to give it a more realistic look.
meanings.sent3: The child's attempt to humpier the snowman resulted in a lopsided creation.
meanings.sent4: The gardener used extra soil to humpier the flower bed for better drainage.
meanings.sent5: The artist used her hands to humpier the shape of the pottery on the wheel.

meanings.sent1: The camel's back was humpier than the dromedary's.
meanings.sent2: The road became humpier as we approached the mountainous region.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked even humpier after the baker added extra layers.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky seemed humpier than usual, casting shadows below.
meanings.sent5: The backpack felt humpier with each additional item stuffed inside.
